page.title: 09Ecology - Whiteparish Area
page.content: {Northern Sector}- Arable Farming on chalk.{Southern Sector}- Dairy Farming on part clay in the West & on chalk or sand in the East. The woods & copses all consist mainly of{coppiced hazel. Most of these have not been managed for at least 30/40 yrs. at least, but a few are still used for fencing & thatching spars. The woods are very old and the land may well not have been used for any other purpose _ as shown by ,"indicator", plants such as Garlic, Field Maple, Wood Spurge etc. Some hedges are 600 to 800 yrs. old. {A current survey involving over 200 {volunteers}over the period 1984 - 1990 has already discovered 254 different plants & many more will certainly be discovered. The Duke of Argyll's Tea Plant-(probably escaped from a cottage garden), the Wild Service Tree & rare orchids are among those found so far.
